MCQ: What is the primary difference between deep learning and traditional machine learning?
Choices: a: Deep learning uses simpler neural networks. | b: Deep learning can only use supervised learning. | c: Deep learning models typically have hundreds or thousands of layers. | d: Deep learning requires labeled data.

MCQ: Which type of neural network is primarily used for image classification?
Choices: a: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) | b: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) | c: Autoencoders | d: Transformer models

MCQ: What is the role of backpropagation in deep learning?
Choices: a: To feed data into the input layer | b: To adjust weights and biases by calculating prediction errors | c: To classify images | d: To generate new data

MCQ: Which process in a neural network helps in refining predictions by moving forward through the layers?
Choices: a: Backpropagation | b: Forward propagation | c: Gradient descent | d: Pooling

MCQ: What is one major advantage of using autoencoders?
Choices: a: They require labeled data for training. | b: They can generate new sample data for text or image generation. | c: They are primarily used for time-series data. | d: They are less computationally demanding than RNNs.

MCQ: Which of the following is a disadvantage of Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)?
Choices: a: They cannot handle sequential data. | b: They are prone to exploding and vanishing gradient problems. | c: They are not suitable for natural language processing. | d: They cannot use unsupervised learning.

MCQ: What is a primary use case for Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)?
Choices: a: Predicting stock market trends | b: Creating realistic but fake images | c: Detecting credit card fraud | d: Translating languages

MCQ: What advantage do transformer models have over previous models?
Choices: a: They process words in parallel, speeding up training. | b: They are less complex than RNNs. | c: They do not require any training data. | d: They are primarily used for image classification.

MCQ: Which deep learning model is particularly useful for tasks involving sequential or time-series data?
Choices: a: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) | b: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) | c: Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) | d: Diffusion models

MCQ: What is a potential disadvantage of diffusion models compared to GANs?
Choices: a: They are more prone to mode collapse. | b: They require adversarial training. | c: They can require more computing resources to train. | d: They cannot generate realistic images.
